body:
I do some experiments with runc and containerd. 
I know how to run docker and runc on a ramdisk, but haven't found such a option for containerd?

docker
```
DOCKER_RAMDISK=true
```

runc 
```
--no-pivot                do not use pivot root to jail process inside rootfs.  This should be used whenever the rootfs is on top of a ramdisk
```

But how start a container with containerd / ctr?
```
/ # ctr run --rm -t docker.io/library/alpine:latest test1
INFO[0023] shim containerd-shim started                  address="/containerd-shim/default/test1/shim.sock" debug=false module="containerd/tasks" pid=877
INFO[0023] shim reaped                                   id=test1 module="containerd/tasks"
ctr: OCI runtime create failed: container_linux.go:296: starting container process caused "process_linux.go:398: container init caused \"rootfs_linux.go:107: jailing process inside rootfs caused \\\"pivot_root invalid argument\\\"\"": unknown
```

I also have some problems to pull images. It fails without `--debug`, but works fine if I add it to debug the error?


containerd version: 
```
/ # containerd --version
containerd github.com/containerd/containerd v1.0.0 89623f28b87a6004d4b785663257362d1658a729
```

runc version:
```
runc version 1.0.0-rc4+dev
commit: 74a17296470088de3805e138d3d87c62e613dfc4
spec: 1.0.0
```
title: How to use containerd on ramdisk?
